title: Trying to find a website
body:
I want to look very in depth to some champions numbers. Such as their AP ratios.

Is there a website where I could find everything out about every champion?

Im looking to find out exactly how Ivern's Ult's ratios all shake out.

[I hope this is ok within the general Help Board]

replies.body: Best source for "technical data" about LoL currently is the wikia: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/League_of_Legends_Wiki

We don't have anything on our website, but I'm sure there are plenty of third-party sites that may have this type of feature. Unfortunately, I don't personally know of any so I can't suggest one, but I'm sure someone can chime in with one.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

1. Best source for "technical data" about LoL currently is the wikia: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/League_of_Legends_Wiki (And if you really didn't know about it, well you should definitely have a look at it...)
2. I agree with Ixian below. This should be on a Riot-owned resource, just so we can expect some level of precision and timeliness. The guys from the wiki are doing an incredible job, but they are fans and volunteers, we can't (and shouldn't) expect them to be 100% correct all the time.

Why do you not have them on a Riot-owned website? For that matter, why aren't they in the game already where everyone can plainly see them instead of playing hide and seek to find them on a 3rd party website? I don't understand that at all. Is Riot intentionally trying to make things more difficult?
